post.description: Scitran Authentication
Remove authtokens for user

Use filters in the payload to exclude/include files.
To pass a single filter, each of its conditions should be satisfied.
If a file pass at least one filter, it is included in the targets.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description:
A string to customize the name of the download
in the format <prefix>_<timestamp>.tar.gz.
Defaults to "scitran".

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Download files with tag 'incomplete' OR type 'dicom'

get.summary: Download files listed in the given ticket.
get.description:
You can use POST to create a download ticket
The files listed in the ticket are put into a tar archive,
which is then compressed with gzip (.tar.gz)

parameters.description: ID of the download ticket
parameters.name: ticket

200.description: The requested tarball download as a binary stream

400.description: Ticket not for this source IP

post.summary: Multipart form upload with N file fields, each with their desired filename.
post.description:
For technical reasons, no form field names can be repeated. Instead, use (file1, file2) and so forth.
A non-file form field called "metadata" is also required, which must be a string containing JSON.
See api/schemas/input/labelupload.json for the format of this metadata.

402.description: Uploads must be from an authorized drone

post.summary: Bottom-up UID matching of Multipart form upload with N file fields, each with their desired filename.
post.description:
Upload data, allowing users to move sessions during scans without causing new data to be
created in referenced project/group.


### Evaluation Order:

* If a matching acquisition UID is found anywhere on the system, the related files will be placed under that acquisition.
* **OR** If a matching session UID is found, a new acquistion is created with the specified UID under that Session UID.
* **OR** If a matching group ID and project label are found, a new session and acquisition will be created within that project
* **OR** If a matching group ID is found, a new project and session and acquisition will be created within that group.
* **OR** A new session and acquisition will be created within a special "Unknown" group and project, which is only visible to system administrators.

402.description: Uploads must be from an authorized drone

post.summary: Multipart form upload with N file fields, each with their desired filename.
post.description:
Same behavior as /api/upload/label,
 except the metadata field must be uid format
 See api/schemas/input/uidupload.json for the format of this metadata.

402.description: Uploads must be from an authorized drone

post.summary: Multipart form upload with N file fields, each with their desired filename.
post.description:
Accepts uploads to an existing data hierarchy, matched via Session
and Acquisition UID
See api/schemas/input/uidmatchupload.json for the format of this metadata.

402.description: Uploads must be from an authorized drone

404.description: Session or Acquisition with uid does not exist

post.summary: Clean up expired upload tokens and invalid token directories.

200.description: Expired and invalid tokens have been cleaned

post.summary: Upload a list of file fields.
post.description:
### Default behavior:
 >Uploads a list of file fields sent as file1, file2, etc to an existing
  container and updates fields of the files, the container and it's
  parents as specified in the metadata fileformfield using the
  engine placer class

### When ``level`` is ``analysis``:
> Uploads a list of files to an existing analysis object, marking
  all files as ``output=true`` using the job-based analyses placer
  class.  See schemas/input/analysis.json

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Object encoded as a JSON string.
By default JSON must match the specified enginemetadata.json schema
If ``level`` is ``analysis``, JSON must match AnalysisUploadMetadata schema
Which level to store files in
parameters.name: level

parameters.description: The ID of the container to place files in
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Required if ``level`` is ``analysis``
parameters.name: job

get.description:
Files can be downloaded directly from this endpoint with a valid "Authorization" header or via a ticket id.

To generate a ticket:
  - Make a request with an empty "ticket" parameter and a valid "Authorization" header. The server will respond with a generated ticket id.
  - Make another request with the received ticket id in the "ticket" parameter. A valid "Authorization" header is no longer required.

When "view" is true, [RFC7233](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7233) range request headers are supported.

parameters.name: ticket
parameters.description: The generated ticket id for the download, or present but empty to generate a ticket id

parameters.name: view
parameters.description:
If true, the proper "Content-Type" header based on the file's mimetype is set on response
If false, the "Content-Type" header is set to "application/octet-stream"

parameters.name: info
parameters.description: If the file is a zipfile, return a json response of zipfile member information

parameters.name: member
parameters.description: The filename of a zipfile member to download rather than the entire file

delete.description:
A user with read-write or higher permissions on the container may delete files that were uploaded by users or were the output of jobs. (Specifically, files whose `origin.type` is either `job` or `user`.)
A user with admin permissions on the container may delete any file.

get.summary: List a user's permissions for this collection.

put.summary: Update a user's permission for this collection.

post.summary: Update info for a particular file.

When query param "job" is "true", send JSON to create
an analysis and job.  Otherwise, multipart/form-data
to upload files and create an analysis.

parameters.name: job
parameters.description: Return job as an object instead of an id

200.description: Returns the id of the analysis that was created.

parameters.name: inflate_job
parameters.description: Return job as an object instead of an id

ContainerName
parameters.description: The parent container type

parameters.name: ContainerId
parameters.description: The parent container id

parameters.name: SubcontainerName
parameters.description: The sub container type

get.summary: Get nested analyses for a container
get.description:
Returns analyses that belong to containers of the specified type that belong to ContainerId. 
For example: `projects/{ProjectId}/acquisitions/analyses` will return any analyses  that have an acquisition that is under that project as a parent.
The `all` keyword is also supported, for example: projects/{ProjectId}/all/analyses  will return any analyses that have any session or acquisition or the project itself as a parent.

200.description: A list of results of the search query

post.summary: Perform path based lookup of nodes in the Flywheel hierarchy
post.description:
This will perform a deep lookup of a node (i.e. group/project/session/acquisition) and its children,
including any files. The query path is an array of strings in the following order (by default):

  * group id
  * project label
  * session label
  * acquisition label

An ID can be used instead of a label by formatting the string as `<id:project_id>`. The full path
to the node, and the node's children will be included in the response.

ApiKey.name: Authorization
ApiKey.description:
Your API key is available on your Profile page from within the Flywheel Application.
**NOTE:** The API key should be prefixed with `scitran-user` if you're testing APIs on this page.

e.g. `scitran-user dev.flywheel.io:DFCAds356sdvd`.

200:deleted-with-count.description: The given number of records were deleted.

200:modified-with-count.description: The given number of records were updated.

200:modified-with-count-and-jobs.description: The number of records modified and number of jobs started.

400:invalid-body-json.description: JSON did not validate against schema for this endpoint.

404:resource-not-found.description: The specified resource could not be found.

acquisition-metadata-input.x-note: Are all of these fields still used/valid? Can this be reconciled with enginemetadata.json#/definitions/uid-upload-input?

container-reference.description: A reference to an individual container, by type and id

file-reference.description: A reference to an individual file in a container, by type, id and name

gear-config.description: Schema snippets describing the options this gear consumes. Not currently processed.

gear-custom.description: A place for gear authors to put arbitrary information.

gear-environment.description: Environment variables that should be set for the gear.

description.description: Hackaround for description not technically being a schema directive

optional.description: Allow the gear to mark an input file as optional.

gear-inputs.description: Schema snippets describing the inputs this gear consumes.

gear-exchange.description: Metadata object that describes the origin of a gear version

git-commit.description: The SHA-1 hash referring to the git commit

rootfs-hash.description: The cryptographic hash of the root filesystem in the form of "algorithm:<base16 hash>"

rootfs-url.description: The absolute URL of the gear's root file system

maintainer.description: (optional) The maintainer of this gear. Can be used to distinguish the algorithm author from the gear maintainer.

cite.description: (optional) Any citations relevant to the algorithm(s) or work present in the gear.

description.description: A brief description of the gear's purpose. Ideally 1-4 sentences.

command.description: If provided, the starting command for the gear, rather than /flywheel/v0/run. Will be templated according to the spec.

label.description: The human-friendly name of this gear.

source.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

url.description: A valid URI, or empty string.

version.description: A human-friendly string explaining the release version of this gear. Example: 3.2.1

gear-doc.description: A full gear description, including manifest and exchange information

info-update-input.description: Helper endpoint for editing an object's info key

return_type.description: Sets the type of search results to return

search_string.description: Represents the plain text search query

all_data.description: When set will include all data that the user does not have access to read

enum: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
